result.execSummary:
The defendant Anton C Ouradnik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of extended supervision are the same as conditions of probation.
Consecutive to prison sentence being served.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary, including any statutorily authorized surcharges, joint and several with co-Defendant. If co-Defendant pays restitution in full, Defendant is to pay 1/2 of total to co-Defendant.
No contact direct or indirect with victims or co-Defendant.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.  Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 5 years if all conditions, including payment of all financial obligations, have been completed and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections.
Perform 40 hours of uncompensated community service with non-profit agency.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anton C Ouradnik in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin.  Defendant Anton C Ouradnik in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2, 4. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2, 4. Counts 3, 5 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status and understands concept of party to a crime. Discussion regarding review of Kewaunee County PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
re: Kewaunee County cases
(filed in Kewaunee County 6/4/15)
to Transport

Defendant Anton C Ouradnik appeared by phone from Oshkosh Correctional. Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of offer from State, requests plea/sentencing in 30 days, questions whether new PSI will be required since one was just done in 2015. Court questions whether recommendation will be joint. Defense advises of questions regarding credit. Court would not need additional PSI. Defense will draft order to have PSI and revocation packet sent here. If not going to be a plea, Defense to advises to avoid unnecessary transport.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anton C Ouradnik in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin. Defendant Anton C Ouradnik in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant is not prepared for plea today, did not expect Defendant to be transported, has not been appointed on Kewaunee County case yet. Defense questions whether PSI would be necessary, had one in March in Kewaunee County, is projected to be released from prison in July, 2017 but that could change based on programming. Discussion regarding offer, which has not been put in writing. Court might need updated PSI. State suggests date in January with Defendant appearing by phone  Status conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
to Transport
Defendant requests that bond be revoked. Defense makes argument for revocation of bond so he gets credit for time served. Court denies motion, will leave bond as is.
Oshkosh Correctional

Defendant Anton C Ouradnik appeared by video from Oshkosh. Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that she is waiting to be appointed by PD's office in Kewaunee, requests another hearing, would let Court know if Defendant needs to be brought here.  Status conference scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 10:15 am.
Video conference confirmed with Oshkosh.
from State requesting that Defendant appear by phone/video. Per Court, ok w/me.

Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Defense advises that Defendant has been charged in Kewaunee County for burglary, will be requesting to be appointed in that case as well, requests plea/sentencing date. State advises that they will be in contact with Defense 10 days prior to next hearing to determine if Defendant will be here in person or not. Status conference set for November 23, 2015 at 9:45 a.m.
by State

Defendant Anton C Ouradnik appeared by video from Dodge Correctional. Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared in Court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises of sentence on Kewaunee revocation, questions if waiver of prelim can be handled by video. Waiver can be handled by phone.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 09:45 am.
by Defendant

Defendant Anton C Ouradnik appeared by phone from Kewaunee County Jail. Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defense advises that sentencing after revocation is scheduled for next Friday in Kewaunee County.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
by Defendant

Defendant Anton C Ouradnik appeared by video from Kewaunee County Jail. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Audio issues - neither end can hear the other.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 7/27/15.
Video conference scheduled for 8/6 with Kewaunee County Jail
No contact direct or indirect with WR, Wave Point Marina and Resort, any Marathon gas station in Door or Kewaunee Counties.

Defendant Anton C Ouradnik in court, in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Atty Gerbers speaks with Defendant, advises that he qualifies, will be appointing case out. Defendant is on PO hold. Bond set. Defendant can appear by video from Kewaunee if still on hold.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.
or Transport defendant for court on 7/27/15.
